Dialectical Behavior Therapy Skills are a must, not just for people who have BPD (Borderline Personality Disorder), but for just about anyone living in this world alongside others.

DBT Skills Groups are booked out weeks and often times months in advance. This means that if you want to get in one, you may be waiting for a long long time, especially if NOW is when you need help.

DBT Skills Groups focus on SKILLS. This means that practicing the skills is much more important than anything else. And luckily, once you learn the skills, you will retain them for the rest of your life!

If you are practicing DBT Skills and want a Diary Card, this app is great for you since it has the following:
• A Calendar to add a Daily Diary Card with 28 DBT skills.
• Descriptions of each skill if you forget
• Examples of each skill
• Statistical information based on 1 day, 7 days, 28 days, or ALL records. That way if you are in a weekly DBT class, you can easily see which skills you have been focusing on, and which you have been missing.
• A Notification reminder that you can set to remind you daily at a specific time to do your DBT Skills Diary Card.
• Beautiful photos and artwork along with a backdrop that changes based on what season we are in (Summer, Autumn, Winter, Spring).

* THE BEST JOURNAL APP TO IMPROVE YOUR MOOD *

CBT Thought Diary is a journal with a purpose: it uses effective tools from Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT), and Positive Psychology to help improve your mood.

Do you feel like youre always stressed, anxious, sad, frustrated, or unmotivated? The centerpiece of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is learning to identify negative and distorted thinking patterns to change your emotions and your behaviors for the better. In CBT, a "thought record" guides you through the steps of identifying, challenging, and reinterpreting negative thinking patterns. With Thought Diary, you can document your negative emotions, analyze flaws in your thinking, and re-evaluate your negative thoughts into more balanced ones. It may even help you recognize helpful ways to deal with your negative behaviors and emotions for future situations.

CBT Thought Diary can do more than thought records, though! It can also be used as a daily mood tracker. You can even practice gratitude by creating positive entries using our flexible diary entry format. According to positive psychology, appreciating the positives in our lives can improve happiness and meaning.
 
With CBT Thought Diary, you can gradually change your approach to how you interpret the ups and downs of life, making long-lasting changes in your mental well-being.

According to positive psychology, practicing gratitude and recording positive emotions is important as well. review:
Users should be aware that you cannot use this app without an access code provided by a health plan or provider. However, you can request a demo on the website of the app: https://mystrength.com/. 

First, there is very little information about the details of the app available on either of the app stores. While most apps at least attempt to give as much descriptive information as possible, this app comes with few details other than stating a few general features e.g. track your mood, join a community, safe and secure. So if anyone is interested in the app the most you have to work with are the pictures, and the website, which is also a little fuzzy on the details.

Second, you cannot download this app unless it has been offered to you by your healthcare provider/benefit plan. You need to sign up on the website with an access code, and there are NO other options available for being able to use this app. So unless it is literally brought to your attention by your health provider, it does not seem as though you can use the app. It is free, but only if you have been given access by your health care provider; you cannot pay for the app yourself it seems.

You can only request to demo the app if you are an organisation willing to collaborate, which is odd. At the very least I would expect such an exclusive app to state so in the very elusive description section.

From the reviews, pictures, and website information it seems as though the app is a good one, however it does not seem to be the best app available. There are a significant number of reviews saying that they do not think all of the content looks as though it is being delivered by professionals, which is concerning given that this is an app essentially endorsed by health care schemes. The website makes grand claims about the outcomes being backed by evidence and studies, but the studies are all featured in journals with low to no impact factor, and there is definitely some graphic deception at play. What looks like an impressive number of studies at first glance on the site, once opened, are not all studies, and the studies did not show up on Google Scholar. My search terms may have been wrong, but at the end of the day it should not be a massive mission to find clinical efficacy of an app if that is a major feature/marketing point.

The privacy policy is thorough, security measures are reported in a nice amount of depth. But there is an interesting potential loop hole I want to point out - under the section where you may delete your data. The privacy policy says you can delete your data, because Your data is yours, however it then goes on to say that while it may be deleted from the primary servers it may not be fully deleted because it may still be around on the back ups of the data. Some may interpret this as transparency, I interpret this as ensuring data can still be kept even if deleted, as people have to accept the privacy policy of any app to use it.

MyLife is a fun, calming and user-friendly app that offers what they claim to offer. Even without a subscription the user of the free version has access to loads of meditation material and resources. The users data is graphically depicted in a colourful presentation that supports a positive atmosphere. One is able to keep track of past meditation practices performed and one can update ones mood regularly to have a record of how mood improves or worsens over weeks, months or overall. I would recommend this app to any person who struggles to unwind or is constantly controlled by racing thoughts, however the app can be utilised by any individual, restless or calm. androidStoreDescription:
What is iCBT?

iCBT is Internet-based Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (iCBT). CBT is effective and commonly used for a variety of mental health concerns. ‘C’ is for cognitive and refers to what and how we think. ‘B’ is for behavioral or how we act. Cognitive-Behavioral is about the relationship between our thoughts, emotions, and behaviors.

Those thoughts, emotions, and behaviours connect to our moods, our physical experiences, and events in our lives. Being aware of how negative thoughts about an event or experience might be affecting how we act, or perceive a situation, can change our emotional, behavioural and physical responses to it.

Morneau Shepell’s AbilitiCBT is CBT delivered by a therapist through an app. Combining a personalized therapist-guided program with digital tools and exercises to bring CBT to life wherever and whenever needed.

Mobile access. Therapy that meets you where you are.

Digital therapy means easy access available 24/7 from any mobile device making it easy to incorporate therapy into your daily life without the additional time and travel requirements of in-person therapy.

Supported by a trained CBT therapist

Every program includes a dedicated CBT therapist who will review all of the work and activities in the program. The therapist will guide the treatment plan accordingly, which may mean suggesting new activities or revisiting modules. The therapist is also available through via messaging to offer feedback and support.

Interactive exercises and activities

Each module contains activities, videos and assignments to help you learn, develop and practice new skills. Activities are seen by your therapist who will review and provide direction and support.

How it works

All programs will start with a clinically validated screening which assesses for depression, anxiety, substance abuse, mania, sleep, and other mental health conditions.

The therapist will review the screening results to create a personalized program.

Each program contains a series of modules that follow an established CBT framework: assessing your current state, education and lessons, skill building, reinforcement and reassessment. The therapist will guide you throughout by reviewing and providing feedback on all exercises and modules. When you are ready the therapist will make the next module available in your program.

Reduce anxiety and build stress resilience with Personal Zen. Backed by a decade of NIH-supported clinical research, this mobile game rewires subconscious habits of thinking to reduce stress and anxiety.* It just takes a few minutes a day, 4 days a week! Based on your current stress levels, a daily goal of gameplay is recommended (typically between 6-10 minutes). Then, you can choose from a number of different game regions and start playing to meet your daily goal. It’s that simple!
In addition to gameplay, you can also access brief, science-backed tools to support your mental health journey including:
-Journaling & mood tracking to help identify feelings and triggers
-Breathing exercises to calm anxiety and improve sleep
-Mindfulness practices to regulate emotions and reduce stress

*Safety and efficacy claims have not been evaluated by the FDA. Personal Zen is available via the Enforcement Discretion Policy introduced by the FDA in April 2020, allowing computerized behavioral therapies for anxiety disorders to be commercially distributed without a 510(k) premarket notification and a prescription.


HOW DO I USE PERSONAL ZEN?
Start by completing a daily check-in and tune into your stress and mood. The check-in helps determine your personalized goal for game play. To use Personal Zen, look for the sparkle to follow the friendly sprite (the smiling face) after it disappears. Dont try to capture the friendly sprite. Simply tap on the sparkle quickly, then smoothly trace the path left in its wake. A “medallion” will appear, telling you where to focus your attention next. Don’t let the angry sprite divert your focus from finding the sparkle. It’s natural to sometimes trace the path a couple of times to achieve accuracy. Play until reaching your goal for the day.

Do a mood check-in or visit the Positive Practices area to take a few minutes to review tips and tools for reducing stress and anxiety from Dr. Tracy, creator of Personal Zen. Personal Zen offers science-based tools, like breathing exercises, musical therapy, and journaling, among other tips that help better manage stress and anxiety.

HOW DOES PERSONAL ZEN WORK?
During gameplay, angry and happy sprites briefly appear then disappear. You are then prompted to trace the trail left by the happy sprite. During gameplay, you might notice that your attention draws to the angry sprite instead of the happy sprite. This is called ‘threat bias’ - a subconscious habit of attention that drives you to focus on negative information at the expense of the positive. Threat bias acts like an information filter that distorts your ability to cope with anxiety, sparking vicious cycles of distress and worry. By playing the game, we change this habit and shift your threat bias to focus more on the positive, rather than the negative. Personal Zen helps to short-circuit these negative habits of attention and allows the user to develop a more flexible and positive focus.

Brief training with Personal Zen can even reduce your body’s stress response! Our studies show that using the app 6-10 minutes a day, 4 days a week reduces levels of stress hormones known as cortisol, and reduces anxiety.

Improve your stress resilience and reduce anxiety today - try the app free for 30 days!

Through this proprietary approach to ABM, Personal Zen uses gamification to target neural pathways associated with emotional and attentional patterns that can drive excessive anxiety and distress.

This app is intended to provide evidence-based information on generalized anxiety (GAD), social anxiety and depression. It has brief Cognitive Behavioural Therapy exercises that you can do but it also connects you to a trained coach whos credentials and training in evidence-based treatments are checked. You cannot change your coach that you are connected to.

The app developers have included a screening and a warning to those who do not only experience GAD, social anxiety and depression that the app may not be suitable. 

The company has included insurance companies and employers in order to introduce benefits for using the app and make the price of the app free, which has made the app inaccessible for people without health insurance or job.

Peer Support is a program consisting of co-workers who are trained to identify various symptoms, challenges, and aid their fellow co-workers by providing support.

Public Safety Peer Support/ Supervisor Coach contains a Support section that is designed to provide peer supporters/supervisors with a quick, handy reference of topics that are taught in the Basic, and Advanced  Peer Support, Critical Incident Stress Management and Leadership/Supervisor classes.  It allows public safety peer supporters and supervisors an easy way to access information without having to refer back to class manuals. When a peer support or supervisor makes contact with a troubled co-worker it can be invaluable to have the information at their fingertips and be able to provide answers and solutions immediately.

It also provides department administrators/supervisors with a useful reference to facts and clinically proven solutions to common personnel issues.  During a critical incident or in the case of making a death notification, having this information at your fingertips on your smart phone or tablet can increase the confidence level on what to do and say.   
Public Safety Peer Support/Supervisor Coach also includes a feature on Resources that contains topics; such as recommended reading material, links to informational videos, and other helpful forms and publications.

It also includes a Referral feature that lists phone numbers and web addresses for hundreds of helpful resources; such as substance abuse, cancer support groups, and phone numbers of mental health professionals who support public safety professionals. 

The content for this app was developed by a team of mental health professionals who specialize in Public Safety Wellness and Critical Incident Stress Management. As a team they are also experts in public safety leadership/supervisor and peer support training.  The content includes the latest information regarding best practices that are presently in place in the public safety field.  The content will be continually updated and additional topics will be added.

Key Features of this app include:
•  Over 20 categories of common support areas
•  Breakdown of subtopics for each topic including definitions, examples and steps to take for action plans
•  Frequently asked questions for each topic
•  Valuable resources easily accessible by PDF files or web links
•  Referrals that include locations, web addresses and phone numbers
•  Stress management and wellness tips

review: The app is straightforward and easy to use, with a friendly bot that starts a chat with the user when opening the app. The bot, Tomo, asks how the user is and present assessments that will look at the users mood and overall well-being. The app is very habit-focused, where the user can choose which habits they want to learn or follow and will send reminders to the user to remind them to do certain activities that are relevant to the habits. After doing the habit, Tomo asks the user to take a picture that counts as "proof" that the user did what they said they want to, where other users can then approve or disagree whether you did what you were supposed to, without any direct contact and likes. In this way, it keeps the user accountable and makes sure that the person can work on themselves and achieve their goals. The user, however, has a short free trial, and after that, there is a monthly subscription that needs to be paid.  The apps functioning is a clever way of making sure people build better habits that will help with their mental health and well-being.

Even without a subscription the user of the free version has access to loads of meditation material and resources. There are 17 essential things you need to know to fast track your recovery from mental illness. The Mental Health Recovery Guide (MHRG) will tell you what they are.

If you suffer from depression, schizophrenia or bipolar disorder, and if you are a mental health outpatient, or a newly discharged psychiatric in-patient at the UK’s NHS or elsewhere in the world, MHRG will help you to get well and stay well.

The app is not just for the UK’s NHS patients but for the whole family of mental health sufferers everywhere. To date, it has been downloaded by users from 30 COUNTRIES around the world.

• BEST INFORMATION & ADVICE FROM THE NHS & OTHER LEADERS
The app contains the most up-to-date evidence-based treatment, advice, support and self-help remedies that have proven to be successful with patients around the world, and that you can do yourself, without the need for a doctor. 

All of MHRG’s featured information and advice has been obtained directly from the world’s leading healthcare institutions, including the NHS, the World Health Organisation, the European Food Standards Authority, the Royal College of Psychiatrists, the New England Journal of Medicine and King’s College London.

• SIMPLE TREATMENT REMEDIES YOU CAN DO YOURSELF
All of the Mental Health Recovery Guide’s advice is simple, and even fun. For example, how can dancing help with depression, or other forms of mental illness? How much water should you drink to improve your mental health? These and other questions are answered within our alternative guide to healing and self-betterment.

Other healthcare topics cover diet, exercise, vitamins, positive thinking and love.

• ‘SUPER VIEW’ OFFERS EXPANDED ADVICE, SUPPORT & TREATMENT
The Mental Health Recovery Guide’s 17 essentials are conveyed via a scrolling sequence of short, simple sentences. For deeper learning, each sentence is hyperlinked to a ‘super view’ — a connecting page featuring more detailed advice, support and self-help treatment options. As you scroll through the app, simply tap any sentence to access it. Super view is updated monthly with the latest treatment research results from around the world.

• A DAILY REMINDER ABOUT YOUR HEALING
Use the alarm feature to remind yourself to consult the app each day. Whether you suffer from depression, psychotic episodes or other psychiatric illness, let the Mental Health Recovery Guide frame your day and guide your healing actions.

• CHANGE YOURSELF, CHANGE THE SYSTEM
MHRG’s approach to mental health is one of self-help — of taking back your power to affect your own positive change.

By using MHRG to take responsibility for your own healing, you will be doing your bit to take the pressure off your country’s resources, thereby saving the NHS, or other healthcare system, money that can be re-deployed to support others like you.

By doing this you can change the system, and yourself.

Download now, and begin.

MENTAL HEALTH RECOVERY GUIDE (MHRG): BEST FEATURES
• 17 ESSENTIAL GUIDELINES: Covering diet, exercise, medication, positive thinking and love.
• SUPER VIEW: Tap any of the guidelines to access expanded info about treatment and self-help remedies.
• COOL STYLE: Information is presented in scrolling sentences of bold yellow type for enhanced impact.
• DAILY REMINDER: Start your day right — set a time to read the app each morning.
• CUSTOMISE YOUR LOOK: Choose from four background colours.

MHRG is free. There are no pop-ups for ads or other purchases. No registration of any kind is required, and there are no requests for users to disclose any information of a personal or confidential nature. 

If you like it, write a review and spread the word to others within the community.

Discover more of our apps at www.365positivity.com

review: Talkspace is a popular app for online counseling/therapy. The app asks the user a few questions then matches them with a therapist. It provides text-based or audio/video-based therapy. The app also contains symptom tracking and goal setting with exercises and a feature called "Journey" that includes a plan set between the patient and therapist. The app has a nice user-interface. The app is free to download (which includes a few exercises and videos), but to start therapy, there are multiple options/costs (text-based only, 1 audio/video session per month, 1 audio/video session per week, couples therapy, teen therapy). The cost ranges from $260 to $396 per month. Online audio/video sessions are only 30-mins which I found to be a bit shorter compared to other popular therapy apps like Betterhelp (50-mins).

WHEN HOLDING YOUR BABY, LEIA IS HOLDING YOU
It takes up to a year to recover physically and mentally as a new mother. Thats why LEIA Health exists, your complete maternal support before and after your delivery.

PREPARE YOURSELF FOR THE TIME AFTER CHILDBIRTH
Pregnancy is usually preoccupied with planning for the baby, but what about you? Together with our experts, we have collected everything you need to know as a new mother. You will find answers about pregnancy, childbirth, feeding, breastfeeding, kegel exercises, sleep deprivation, baby blues, postpartum depression and much, much more.

PERSONAL RECOVERY PLAN
It can take a long time to recover from childbirth, but there are ways to make the journey smoother. LEIA Health supports you with a recovery plan personalised to your needs, based on your own experiences and conditions.

TEST FOR POSTPARTUM DEPRESSION
The postpartum period can be difficult enough without having to worry about your mental well-being. Yet, 1 in 10 of all mothers and fathers get postpartum depression. With LEIA Health, you can test yourself for postpartum depression and learn how to pay attention to your symptoms at an early stage. Created together with scientists at Karolinska Institutet.

FEATURE FOR BREASTFEEDING, BOTTLE FEEDING AND PUMPING
Feeding your baby is a big part of your daily life as a mother. But if you find yourself struggling, you are not alone, as most new mothers experience problems when breastfeeding. LEIAs feeding tracker will help you keep track of both breastfeeding and bottle feeding to make all parents feel supported, no matter how you feed your baby.

STRENGTHEN YOUR PELVIC FLOOR WITH LEIA
Your pelvic floor is important and holds lots of functions in the body. Through our 6-week training program, you can build up your internal muscles, which can avoid prolapse and incontinence. Before and after your childbirth.
